intro: Osmorhiza dulcis, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for their licorice-like flavor and are used in herbal medicine. Osmorhiza dulcis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
